description: repairAction:Check the python script for syntactic and semantic issues.
probableCause:This alarm is raised when memory exhausts on system on which Kafka is running.
specificProblem:Due to this problem, VNF-PM will not be able to save the monitoring reports and auto-scaling functionality will not work.
repairAction: Check the memory status on the system. If required, clear some old data. Also check the Kafka settings, configure the autoclear data time frame.
probableCause:This alarm is raised when some error has occurred at VNF-PM leading to thread creation failure.
specificProblem:Due to this problem, VNF-PM will not be able to collect the monitoring reports and auto-scaling functionality will not work.
probableCause:This alarm is raised when VNF monitoring is received from un-authorized source
repairAction: Check if monitoring source is authorized or not
probableCause:When this alarm is triggered when the systems on which VNFMM are running are not reachable from VNF-PM
specificProblem:The effect of this alarm is that the system will be accessible but some operations may be blocked
repairAction: Check the ip and port of Monitoring Manager module in application configuration file. Also check tomcat and module logs.
probableCause:This alarm will be raised when the parameter value of 'isHeat' paramter in config.properties file in not correct.
specificProblem:The effect of alarm is that any of the triggered LCM operation(including deploy/terminate) will not performed.
repairAction:Check value for parameter isHeat in application configuration file.

event.Summary: Wrong parameter for isHeat in config properties file

description: probableCause:This alarm will be raised when the parameter 'virtual-binding' in NSD is incorrect and does not match with the defined routers in the descriptor.
specificProblem:NSD will not be able to deploy

event.Summary: Virtual binding ID in NSD connection point is invalid

description: probableCause:This alarm will be raised when the parameter 'virtuallink-id' in NSD is incorrect and does not match with the defined virtual links in the descriptor
specificProblem:NSD will not be able to deploy

event.Summary: Virtual binding ID in NSD connection point is invalid

description: probableCause:This alarm will be raised when the parameter 'virtual-binding' in VNFD is incorrect and does not match with the defined routers/vdus in the descriptor.
specificProblem:VNFD will not be able to deploy

event.Summary: Virtual binding ID present in VNFD connection point is invalid

description: probableCause:This alarm will be raised when the parameter 'virtuallink-id' in VNFD is incorrect and does not match with the defined virtual links in the descriptor.
specificProblem:VNFD will not be able to deploy

event.Summary: Virtual ID present in VNFD connection point is invalid

description: probableCause:This alarm will be raised when the multiple management network is given for different internal network on same instance.
specificProblem:VNFD will be able to deploy with taking any random floating IP out of all the management networks IP.

event.Summary: Multiple management netowrk for same virtual machine

repairAction:Check module logs for DM & LCM.

description: repairAction: Check module logs for DM , VIMPL and LCM.

repairAction:Check module logs for DM & VIMPL.

description: repairAction: Check module logs for DM & VIMPL.

repairAction:Check module logs for DM & VIMPL.

probableCause:It could be because of network delay or connectivity issue.
specificProblem:Heart Beat Loss detected from one of the VNFs.
repairAction:Check module logs for DM, LCM , VIMPL and alarms_current Table.
probableCause:Failure of Subscription Request from SM

probableCause:When this alarm has been triggered, It means that the system which is running CNPL is not reachable from VNFLCM
specificProblem:The effect of this alarm is that the system will be accessible but some operations may be blocked
repairAction:Check the ip and port of CNPL module in application configuration file. Also check tomcat and module logs.
repairAction: Check module logs for LCM and DM.
repairAction: Validate the doorbell request for mandatory paramters in LCM logs.

event.Summary: Mandatory parameter missing door bell rejected

description: repairAction:Validate doorbell request for NsdId in LCM logs.

event.Summary: Error in finding Nsd ID for door bell request

description: repairAction:Validate doorbell request for Cloud Profile Id in LCM logs.

event.Summary: Error in finding cloud profile ID for door bell request

description: probableCause:This alarm is triggered if the required cloud plugin jar is not available at the specified cloudPlugin path.
specificProblem:None of the cloud related operations will work.
repairAction: Check the path of cloud plugin in application configuration file
probableCause:This alarm is triggered if the required cloud plugin jar file is available but is invalid.
specificProblem:None of the cloud related operations will work.
repairAction: Check the path of cloud plugin in application configuration file
probableCause:When this alarm has been triggered, It means that the system which is running VNFDM is not reachable from VIMPL
specificProblem:The effect of this alarm is that the system will be accessible but some operations may be blocked
repairAction:Check the ip and port of Proxy manager module in application configuration file. Also check tomcat and module logs.
probableCause:This alarm is raised if the VM created during deployment is not reachable after the set number of retries.
specificProblem:The resources created during deployment are deleted and deployment fails.
repairAction:Check network and VIM serviec logs.
probableCause:This alarm is raised when the image file URL provided during image creation is not reachable
repairAction: Check that file server is running on configured ip and port.
probableCause:When this alarm has been triggered, it means that the corresponding module is not UP.
repairAction:Check IP and port of CMS in application configuration file.
probableCause:When data sending to server having issue..
repairAction: Check graphite server is accessible with ip and port given in application configuration file.
repairAction: Check IP and port of CDPL module in application configuration file.
probableCause:This alarm is raised when system on which Kafka is running is not reachable from VNF-MM
specificProblem:Due to this problem, Monitoring Module will not be able to fetch the monitoring reports and auto-scaling functionality will not work.
repairAction:Check if kafka server is running with kafka ip and port specified in application configuration file.
probableCause:When this alarm is triggered when the systems on which VIMPL are running are not reachable from VNF-PM
specificProblem:The effect of this alarm is that the system will be accessible but some operations may be blocked
repairAction:Check the ip and port of VIMPL module in application configuration file. Also check tomcat and module logs.
probableCause:When this alarm has been triggered, it means that the MariaDB database host at <ID/IP> is not reachable or down
specificProblem:The effect of this alarm is that the system will be accessible but not completely operational.
repairAction: Check that Maria DB is accessible with ip ,port and credentials configured in the application.
repairAction:Check the ip and port of CNPL module in application configuration file. Also check tomcat and module logs.
probableCause:This alarm is raised when the endpoint of the VIM mentioned during POP registration becomes unreachable. This could be because of simple network failure or setup failure
specificProblem:None of the cloud related operations will work on that particular VIM
repairAction:Check VIM paramters in cloud profile and network reachablity.
probableCause:This alarm is raised if the tenant credentials provided during cloud profile creation is not valid or becomes invalid
specificProblem:None of the cloud related operations will work for that cloud profile.
repairAction: Check the credentials of cloud profile in use.
probableCause:When this alarm has been triggered against the module, it means the module is unreachable.
repairAction:Check IP and port of Proxy Manager module in application configuration file.
probableCause:When this alarm has been triggered, it means that the corresponding module is not UP.
repairAction:Check the ip and port of DM module in application configuration file. Also check tomcat and module logs.
probableCause:When this alarm has been triggered, It means that the system which is running VNFLCM is not reachable from VNFDM
specificProblem:The effect of this alarm is that the system will be accessible but some operations may be blocked
repairAction:Check the ip and port of LCM module in application configuration file. Also check tomcat and module logs.
probableCause:When this alarm has been triggered, it means that connection lost between SMM and Cassandra DB
specificProblem:Due to this problem, all operations related to statistics counters / monitoring reports will not be functioning.
repairAction:Check that cassandra DB is accessible with ip,port & credentials configured in the application.
probableCause:When this alarm has been triggered against the module, it means the module is unreachable.
repairAction:Check IP and port of MM module in application configuration file.
probableCause:This alarm is raised when the particular cloud service is not reachable
specificProblem:None of the cloud related operations for that cloud service will work on that particular VIM
repairAction: Check if Ceilometer service is working correctly on the vim interface.
probableCause:Disk Space has been filled up due to VNFM logs
specificProblem:Disk Space has exceeded the configured threshold
repairAction: Cleared when available disk space is below the configured threshold.
probableCause:One of the peer VNFM has gone down
specificProblem:All the VNFs owner will be changed to the Active VNFM.
repairAction: Check module logs for DM, LCM , VIMPL and alarms_current Table.
